allTitles: {"en":"About Coronavirus","es":"Sobre el Coronavirus","zgh":"Γef Avirus n Kuruna"}

4.eng: There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
4.zgh: Dis tɣawsa IĞĞET a bac at-takzed ɣef mammek Avirus n kuruna

12.zgh: Avirus ittcentel lemmi yella g tnuzzut(Tikuffa)

13.eng: Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.

17.eng: So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
17.zgh: Lemmi ad tteẓr-d iğğen/t ittban-d fellas akutti/anuzzi/d maṭṭun ttnejjm-d :

18.eng: Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.
18.zgh: Uc-as a Tamaskt. T/inejjem sis at/ykutt ɣen at/yenzzu dis d wel aṭurri iṭnin ɣer dis-nnes

22.eng: Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
22.zgh: Waqila nettat ca ttmaṭunt, ɣer terra labl f yiman nnes

23.eng: People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
23.zgh: Iwdan lli uṭṭnen wel ittban-d dis aṭṭan, welyuc ttsawaṭen gwaṭṭan

24.eng: And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
24.zgh: D rni fellas, taktit tezzɛam  ac seg agejluṭ (guda n iwdan), maɣer wel tessn-d mant dis t/yella t/yuṭen.

32.eng: & even on the outside of your face mask
32.zgh: D rrni I lli yella berra n tamaskt nnem/k

38.eng: However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
38.zgh: Dis mak, ittṣara d Amaḍun s tikufsa nnes tassnt-d f tiɣawsiwin…

40.zgh: ɣen f udem n tayri nnem/k

42.eng: And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
42.zgh: iṣar d ttmuss-d seg tiɣawsiwin tidhat saht, d sdeffr-as ttmused udem nnem/k,

43.eng: and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
43.zgh: D tɣawsa  iğğet tnejjem aten-tesfeḍ s usired nnes s ṣṣabun, tasemellalt, ɣen iɣisem.

44.eng: Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
44.zgh: Virus inejjem itteqqima yella f tɣawsa  ugar timirt

47.eng: Which is why it is also good to follow these
47.zgh: D ayed i matta d tasbiḥt taḍfrawt tad

48.eng: wash with soap up to here

51.eng: Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
51.zgh: Ttmusset-c udem nnem/k (ɣen udem ḥad iṭen) wel dis-c mammek, ssird-t ifassen nnem/k s ṣṣabun s Taneṭṭuft.

52.eng: Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
52.zgh: Gget n luɣed i yinig “Tafaska n ulul “ sent tikwal

56.eng: wash the back of your hands

58.eng: If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
58.zgh: Wel ttqeqet-c kan iṣar ttmuss-tt. S deffer ssird ifassen nnem/k s ṣṣabun

59.eng: Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
59.zgh: Rrni fellas, ukan dis mammek wel at-tmussd tamaskt s fus.

61.eng: *Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
61.zgh: Tabaktirit ttekker jaj g tamaskt nnem/k lemmi at-tirṭd sis guda.

62.eng: Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
62.zgh: Zzref-tt kull tamaskt lemmi at-semdid sis. Wel at-tirṭd ugar iğğewass !

68.eng: Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
68.zgh: Wel ttnemili-d s Učču, Tirukan , Ṭṭwasi(Aqbuc), Lleffeṭ.

69.eng: You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
69.zgh: Wel tzemmr-d at-tmusd udem nnem/k s tiɣmert nnem/k

70.eng: Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
70.zgh: Arr d aqqes tiwwura s tiɣmert ɣen iɣil muc s ifassen, ukan dis mammek.

72.eng: and after being out in the public
72.zgh: D lemmi  tissi-d berra g uɣlad

74.eng: Always wash your hands with soap…

80.eng: Read the articles for more tips!

81.eng: "This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
81.zgh:
“This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel” by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

Γɣer imegrad i ugar isemtar !

82.eng: "The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
82.zgh: “The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe”, by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)

83.eng: "How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020
83.zgh: “How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands”. By Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, opinion.  (Jan 28,2020)

86.eng:
Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow
﻿For all other uses, please send a request in to: comicsforgood@gmail.com
86.zgh:
Tazmilt Timernant: irray n lbal s uɣus s Kumik d tɣawsa ɣers asemday g asbeddi a guda n waṭṭanen ama Fluwenza d tameslaɣt, d ilaq uɣus kull ass g ussan nneɣ, d ula wel tella lluhef\arwas.
Timselɣa: Talɣut g Kumik tus-d seg tikazt n COVID-19 al 28 Furar 2020,d adasil n Talɣut nnes seg kraḍt Timselɣa tidhat.    
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Talɣut Timernant: Afulyu n PDF seg Kumik a yella i usahwi f umellal dahat:
https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Tamyedrawt n Tamnirt: Kumik a yella f umellal i kull i usebleg g uskar uqqin d f ubrid n  Whatsapp d Telegram, d usehhwi f umellal i useggiz am Akerḍa i yiman nnem\k d usinan g tiddar, tinmal\iɣerbaz d timlilin n twuri.
Lemmi at-tig-d ssis tamyedrawt, ig g lbal i 3 n tiɣawsiwin:1) wel ittṣara kull icckel g iẓrag n Ikumiken lemmi at-tig-d sis tamyedrawt.2)Ikumiken ca i usexdem nnesn g usenfar asenzan
3)g uskar uqqin, ari isem n umeslal g FB s @weimankowart, g IG s @weimankow (IG), ɣen ari iqqin\asmel instagramcom/weimankow I usemres iṭen, enki tabraṭt i:comicsforgood@gmail.com

bookText.eng:
About Coronavirus



There's only ONE thing ﻿you need to understand about how a coronavirus
SPREADS
Mouth
Nose
Eyes
Get into your
Healthy Person
Sick Person
The virus spreads when ﻿these droplets
Keep your distance.﻿2m will keep you safe from large droplets.
1
2m
Achoo!
So if you see someone who is visibly coughing/sneezing/sick you can choose to:
Give them a mask.﻿They can cough or sneeze in it and protects everyone else nearby.
2
Thank you﻿*sniffles*
OR,
Maybe she's not sick, just protecting herself
People who are infected can show no symptoms, but are still﻿infectious
And in general, it's a good idea to avoid crowds, because you don't know who might be sick.
Chopsticks
Healthy person
Train straps
Lift buttons
Tissues
Cups
Digital devices
& even on the outside of your face mask
Stair bannisters
Mouse
Pens
Door knobs
Their hands
However, sometimes a sick person's saliva can get on other things…
you might all fall sick.
or your loved one's face
rub eyes
And if you do touch any of these things by accident, and then touch your face,
and the only effective way to get rid of them is to wash them off with soap, bleach, or alcohol.
Viruses can last for quite a few hours on objects,
soap
precautions
Which is why it is also good to follow these
wash with soap up to here
soap
elbow
Do not touch your face. (Or anyone else's face.) If you have to, wash your hands with soap thoroughly first.
Enough time to sing “Happy Birthday” twice
under the nails
for 20 seconds
between the fingers
wash the back of your hands
What is thoroughly?
If you did, don't worry. Just wash your hands with soap after.
Also, don't touch the outside of the mask if you can.
droplets
*Bacteria grows on the insides of your mask if you wear them too long
Throw away masks once they feel gross. Don't wear them for more than a day!
Use a serving spoon
Baby
Daddy
Mommy
Everyone gets their own towel
Do not share food, utensils, cups, towels.
You can't touch your face with your elbow even if you tried
Open & close doors with your elbows or shoulders instead of hands, if possible.
Home
and after being out in the public
Before you eat
Always wash your hands with soap…
And finally,
soap
Stay safe, everyone!
Stay safe, everyone!
soap
Read the articles for more tips!
"This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel" by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)
"The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe", by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign Policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
"How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands", by Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, Opinion. (Jan 28, 2020

Additional notes:  Hygiene precautions in comic are effective in preventing many other common infections such as flu and cold, and should be applied in every day life, even when there is no epidemic. 
References:  lnformation in comic is based on understanding of COVID19 up till 28 Feb 2020, and mainly from these three references. ﻿https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/ ﻿https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Additonal lnformation  A PDF version of the comic is available for free download here:﻿﻿https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Sharing Guidelines  This comic is free for the general public to share online and through Whatsapp and Telegram, and the downloads are free for printing out as posters for personal and educational use in homes, schools, and workplaces. 
When sharing, please remember these 3 points: ﻿1) No edits to the comics is allowed in any way when sharing.﻿2) Comics cannot be used for any commercial project﻿3) lf online, credit the creator on FB by tagging @weimankowart, on IG by tagging @weimankow (IG), or providing a link to instagram com/weimankow

bookText.zgh:
Γef Avirus n Kuruna



Dis tɣawsa IĞĞET a bac at-takzed ɣef mammek Avirus n kuruna
ITTCENTEL
Imi nnem/k
Tinzert nnem/k
Tiṭṭawin nnem/k
Ittawwaṭ g
Bnadem d Aṣbiḥ
Bnadem d Amaṭun
Avirus ittcentel lemmi yella g tnuzzut(Tikuffa)
Ğğ jar-am/k ag n 2 miter
1
2 miter
Attsu !
Lemmi ad tteẓr-d iğğen/t ittban-d fellas akutti/anuzzi/d maṭṭun ttnejjm-d :
Uc-as a Tamaskt. T/inejjem sis at/ykutt ɣen at/yenzzu dis d wel aṭurri iṭnin ɣer dis-nnes
2
Tanemmirt a *tiḥiṭṭa*
ΓEN
Waqila nettat ca ttmaṭunt, ɣer terra labl f yiman nnes
Iwdan lli uṭṭnen wel ittban-d dis aṭṭan, welyuc ttsawaṭen gwaṭṭan
D rni fellas, taktit tezzɛam  ac seg agejluṭ (guda n iwdan), maɣer wel tessn-d mant dis t/yella t/yuṭen.
Tiqecqac
Bnadem d Aṣbiḥ
Tiddriwin n Cmendfir
Taṭbilt n
Usensir
Lklineks
Ṭṭwasi (Aqbuc)
Allal Umḍin
D rrni I lli yella berra n tamaskt nnem/k
Tidderiwin
Tafekrunt (Aselkim)
Iɣunab
Fus n tawwurt
Ifassen nnes
Dis mak, ittṣara d Amaḍun s tikufsa nnes tassnt-d f tiɣawsiwin…
Waqil ad ttaṭnum ukkul nnwen\t
ɣen f udem n tayri nnem/k
Aḥukki n tiṭṭawin
iṣar d ttmuss-d seg tiɣawsiwin tidhat saht, d sdeffr-as ttmused udem nnem/k,
D tɣawsa  iğğet tnejjem aten-tesfeḍ s usired nnes s ṣṣabun, tasemellalt, ɣen iɣisem.
Virus inejjem itteqqima yella f tɣawsa  ugar timirt
Ṣṣabun
Irray n Lbal
D ayed i matta d tasbiḥt taḍfrawt tad
Ssird s ṣṣabun al tiɣmert
ṣṣabun
tiɣmert
Ttmusset-c udem nnem/k (ɣen udem ḥad iṭen) wel dis-c mammek, ssird-t ifassen nnem/k s ṣṣabun s Taneṭṭuft.
Gget n luɣed i yinig “Tafaska n ulul “ sent tikwal
S addu iccaren
Ag 20 tisinin
Jar iṭuṭan
Ssird s denneg fus nnem/k
Matta nettat Taneṭṭuft ?
Wel ttqeqet-c kan iṣar ttmuss-tt. S deffer ssird ifassen nnem/k s ṣṣabun
Rrni fellas, ukan dis mammek wel at-tmussd tamaskt s fus.
tanuzzut
Tabaktirit ttekker jaj g tamaskt nnem/k lemmi at-tirṭd sis guda.
Zzref-tt kull tamaskt lemmi at-semdid sis. Wel at-tirṭd ugar iğğewass !
Ig s uɣenjay
Aneɛnuc
Baba
Yemma
Kull iğğen\t s lfuṭet nnes
Wel ttnemili-d s Učču, Tirukan , Ṭṭwasi(Aqbuc), Lleffeṭ.
Wel tzemmr-d at-tmusd udem nnem/k s tiɣmert nnem/k
Arr d aqqes tiwwura s tiɣmert ɣen iɣil muc s ifassen, ukan dis mammek.
Taddart
D lemmi  tissi-d berra g uɣlad
Qbel učču
Ssird-t ifassen nnwen s Ṣṣabun…
G uneggaru
Ṣṣabun
Rret Lbal nnwen/t !
Rret Lbal nnwen/t !
Ṣṣabun
Γɣer imegrad i ugar isemtar !
“This animation shows how far your sneeze can actually travel” by Chia Yi Hou and Andrea Schmitz, in Business Insider (Jan 21, 2020)

Γɣer imegrad i ugar isemtar !
“The Wuhan Virus: How to stay safe”, by Laurie Garrett, in Foreign policy, Report. (Jan 25, 2020)
“How to avoid the coronavirus? Wash your hands”. By Elizabeth Rosenthal, in the New York Times, opinion.  (Jan 28,2020)
Tamselɣut tadasilant i taywalt tadawsant:

Tazmilt Timernant: irray n lbal s uɣus s Kumik d tɣawsa ɣers asemday g asbeddi a guda n waṭṭanen ama Fluwenza d tameslaɣt, d ilaq uɣus kull ass g ussan nneɣ, d ula wel tella lluhef\arwas.
Timselɣa: Talɣut g Kumik tus-d seg tikazt n COVID-19 al 28 Furar 2020,d adasil n Talɣut nnes seg kraḍt Timselɣa tidhat.    
https://www.nytimes.com/2020/01/28/opinion/coronavirus-prevention-tips.htmlhttps://foreignpolicy.com/2020/01/25/wuhan-coronavirus-safety-china/  https://www.businessinsider.com/how-far-sneeze-cough-germs-can-travel-2018-10
Talɣut Timernant: Afulyu n PDF seg Kumik a yella i usahwi f umellal dahat:
https://gumroad.com/weimankowart 
Tamyedrawt n Tamnirt: Kumik a yella f umellal i kull i usebleg g uskar uqqin d f ubrid n  Whatsapp d Telegram, d usehhwi f umellal i useggiz am Akerḍa i yiman nnem\k d usinan g tiddar, tinmal\iɣerbaz d timlilin n twuri.
Lemmi at-tig-d ssis tamyedrawt, ig g lbal i 3 n tiɣawsiwin:1) wel ittṣara kull icckel g iẓrag n Ikumiken lemmi at-tig-d sis tamyedrawt.2)Ikumiken ca i usexdem nnesn g usenfar asenzan
3)g uskar uqqin, ari isem n umeslal g FB s @weimankowart, g IG s @weimankow (IG), ɣen ari iqqin\asmel instagramcom/weimankow I usemres iṭen, enki tabraṭt i:comicsforgood@gmail.com
